title: NEW PARTNER
description: If your company is just beginning a partnership with Cisco, Tech Data recommends you start with Core, a Tech Data exclusive training program that shows you how to Navigate Cisco's partner program. We'll cover how to apply for discounts, using Cisco web tools, and the various levels of Cisco partnership and specialization. To book Core, please call 800-237-8931 ext. 77776. Or, to become a registered partner, click here.

title: REGISTERED
description:
New Programs:
  • TMP
Cisco's Channel Partner Program begins with a partner becoming a Registered Partner. Cisco Registered partners are eligible for deviated pricing, Reward and Rebate programs, and Smartnet Services. Registered partners can also purchase demo gear under Cisco's NFR Discount Program.

title: CORE
description:
Navigating the Cisco Partner Program is key to maximizing profitability. The Core serves as a collection of resources for new and existing partners to master key areas of this program. Topics Include:
  • Cisco 101
  • Conquering CCW
  • Navigating Cisco.com
  • Navigating Cisco Certs
To book Core, please call your dedicated PAM at 800-237-8931 ext. 77776.

title: STEP TO SELECT
description: At this step, work with Tech Data's training professionals in TDEducation to book courses and complete testing on the road to becoming a Cisco Select Certified partner. TDEducation can also frequently offer incremental discounts and funded courses for loyal Tech Data Cisco partners. Call a TDEducation sales rep for more information at 800-237-8931 ext. 75002 Or click here for more information.

title: SELECT
description:
New Programs:
  • OIP
  • SIP
  • TIP
Cisco Select Certified partners receive increased access to programs and promotions. Notably Deal Protection (OIP) and Price Protection. 80% NFR discount/100k limit (list price) Select partners also receive access to Cisco Smart Care Services.

title: PREMIER
description:
New Programs:
  • VIP
Premier partners achieve additional product access, as well as recognition as a Premier Certified Partner on Cisco's partner locator. Premier partners also get access to all Cisco programs and promotions. Cisco partners may choose to maintain their Premier status by achieving Express Collaboration or Express Foundation Specialization or any advanced Specialization along with at least one Cisco Powered cloud service, Cisco cloud service, Cloud Powered managed service or Cisco based managed service.

title: GOLD
description: Gold Cisco partners are widely recognized as the most technically knowledgeable and specialized Cisco practices.Gold partners are required to hold four individual CCIEâs on staff, and be specialized in four of Ciscoâs individual architecture tracks.Gold partners are required to hold multiple Cisco architectural specializations and advanced level specializations.Gold partners will also receive additional direct field coverage from Cisco as well as additional economic incentives.Gold partners must also have one individual who holds the Business Value Practitioner Certification.

title: Express Security Email
description:
New Programs:
  • VIP
The Email Track of the Cisco Express Security Specialization tests knowledge in selling, designing, and installing email security solutions. These solutions fight spam and viruses, enforce compliance, and protect corporate email systems of all sizes. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: AM
architectureNodes.description: Account Manager: Responsible for sales methodology and customer engagement.

architectureNodes.title: ASAM
architectureNodes.description: Advanced Security for Account Managers (ASAM) exam is the exam associated with the Cisco Security Advanced Sales Specialist certification. Candidates can prepare for this exam by taking the Security Advanced Sales e-learning course as well as the How to Sell Ironport e-learning course. This exam tests a candidate's knowledge of Cisco security products and product positioning as well as ability to influence key customer decision makers. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: ENG
architectureNodes.description: Presales engineer responsible for security solution planning and design. One qualified individual may fill only the Engineer role in up to two express security specializations. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: SSSE
architectureNodes.description: The Security Solutions for Systems Engineer exam is associated with the Cisco Security Solutions and Design Specialist certification. It tests a candidate's knowledge of Cisco security products and product positioning and where each technology fits in the design of an integrated, collaborative, secure network. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: ESFE
architectureNodes.description: This exam tests your knowledge of securing email systems by requiring you to evaluate, install, operate, and troubleshoot the Email Security Appliance. Click here for more information.

title: Express Security Web
description:
New Programs:
  • VIP
The Cisco Express Security Specialization Web Track tests knowledge in selling, designing, and installing Cisco web security solutions. These solutions provide multiple deployment options and integrate easily into data centers, networks, or branch offices. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: AM
architectureNodes.description: Account Manager: Responsible for sales methodology and customer engagement.

architectureNodes.title: ASAM
architectureNodes.description: The 646-580 Advanced Security for Account Managers (ASAM) exam is the exam associated with the Cisco Security Advanced Sales Specialist certification. Candidates can prepare for this exam by taking the Security Advanced Sales e-learning course as well as the How to Sell Ironport e-learning course. This exam tests a candidate's knowledge of Cisco security products and product positioning as well as ability to influence key customer decision makers. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: ENG
architectureNodes.description: Presales engineer responsible for security solution planning and design. One qualified individual may fill only the Engineer role in up to two Express Security specializations.

architectureNodes.title: SSSE
architectureNodes.description: The Security Solutions for Systems Engineer (642-584) exam is associated with the Cisco Security Solutions and Design Specialist certification. It tests a candidate's knowledge of Cisco security products and product positioning and where each technology fits in the design of an integrated, collaborative, secure network. Topics covered include Cisco Security Appliance (ASA), ASA, IDS/IPS, VPN, Security Management, CS-MARS, NAC Appliance, Cisco Ironport and Scansafe web security. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: WSFE
architectureNodes.description: This exam tests a candidate's knowledge of how to install, configure, operate, and maintain Cisco Web Security products and solutions. Click here for more information.

title: Advanced Security Architecture
description:
New Programs:
  • VIP
The Advanced Security Architecture Specialization can help you build new skills that you need to sell and deploy Cisco Security Solutions. You will build security architectural leadership as you gain industry-recognized branding and market differentiation, create deep knowledge of security architecture for solution development and gain preference from customers seeking value-added solutions.

architectureNodes.title: AM
architectureNodes.description: Account Manager: Responsible for sales methodology and customer engagement.

architectureNodes.title: SBO
architectureNodes.description: Selling Business Outcomes (810-401) is designed to help partners move beyond simple transactional technology sales, and move toward solution selling that solves key business issues.SBO is replacing CSE in all major specializations starting 8-1-2015. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: ASAAMR
architectureNodes.description: This exam tests a candidate's knowledge of Cisco security products and product positioning as well as ability to influence key customer decision makers. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: SE
architectureNodes.description: Architecture Systems Engineer is responsible for presale solution planning. The individual must: Possess both business and technical skills. A Systems Engineer (SE) may fulfill up to two Architecture Specialization SE roles.

architectureNodes.title: CCDA
architectureNodes.description: Cisco Certified Design Associate (CCDA) is for network design engineers, technicians, and support engineers, who enable efficient network environments with an understanding of network design fundamentals. A CCDA certified network professional demonstrates the skills required to design basic campus, data center, security, voice, and wireless networks. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: ASASER
architectureNodes.description: This exam tests a candidate's knowledge of Cisco security products and product positioning as well as ability to influence key customer decision makers. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: FE
architectureNodes.description: Field Engineer: Post-sales engineer responsible for solution implementation and operation. This individual may fill only the FE role in up to 2 different technology specializations (A Technology specialization is an Express or Advanced Level specialization).

architectureNodes.title: CCNPS
architectureNodes.description: Cisco Certified Network Professional Security (CCNP Security) certification program is aligned specifically to the job role of the Cisco Network Security Engineer responsible for Security in Routers, Switches, Networking devices and appliances, as well as choosing, deploying, supporting and troubleshooting Firewalls, VPNS, and IDS/IPS solutions for their networking environments. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: SSFAMP
architectureNodes.description: The Securing Cisco Networks with Sourcefire FireAMP Endpoints exam is designed for technical professionals who need to demonstrate their skills and expertise in the deployment and management of Cisco Advanced Malware Protection in their network environment. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: BOOST
architectureNodes.description: Tech Data's exclusive post-specialization campaigns are available to partners who have completed an Advanced Level Specialization.  Get 1 on 1 sales and go to market training in Tech Dataâs Solutions Center via TelePresence, learn about sales strategies and best practices, and earn demand generation resources to further your brand in the end user community.To begin Boost, call your dedicated partner account manager at 800-237-8931 ext. 77776.

title: Express Security IPS
description:
New Programs:
  • VIP
The Cisco Express Security Specialization Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) focus area requires knowledge in selling, designing, and installing Cisco IPS security solutions. These solutions provide multiple deployment options and integrate easily into data centers, networks, and branch offices. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: AM
architectureNodes.description: Account Manager: Responsible for sales methodology and customer engagement.

architectureNodes.title: IPSEAM
architectureNodes.description: IPS Account Manager Role and tests a candidate's knowledge of and how to position Cisco's Next Generation IPS and Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) solutions. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: ENG
architectureNodes.description: Responsible for solution planning and design. One qualified individual may fill only the Engineer role in up to two Express Security Specializations.

architectureNodes.title: IPSEE
architectureNodes.description: This exam is associated with the Cisco Express Security - IPS Engineer role and tests a candidate's knowledge of Cisco's Next Generation IPS and Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) technologies, and how to position them. Click here for more information.

title: Express Security Specialization
description:
New Programs:
  • VIP
The Next-Generation Firewall track of the Cisco Express Security Specialization tests knowledge in selling, designing, and installing the Cisco ASA 5500-X Series Next-Generation Firewalls. This series blends enterprise-class stateful inspection with next-generation firewall capabilities, such as Application Visibility and Control (AVC), Web Security Essentials (WSE), Intrusion Prevention (IPS), and Virtual Private Networking (VPN). Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: AM
architectureNodes.description: Account Manager: Responsible for sales methodology and customer engagement.

architectureNodes.title: ASAM
architectureNodes.description: The Advanced Security for Account Managers (ASAM) exam is the exam associated with the Cisco Security Advanced Sales Specialist certification. Candidates can prepare for this exam by taking the Security Advanced Sales e-learning course as well as the How to Sell Ironport e-learning course. This exam tests a candidate's knowledge of Cisco security products and product positioning as well as ability to influence key customer decision makers. Click here for more information.

architectureNodes.title: ENG
architectureNodes.description: Presales engineer responsible for security solution planning and design. One qualified individual may fill only the Engineer role in up to two Express Security specializations.

architectureNodes.title: SAEXS
architectureNodes.description: The Cisco ASA Express Security (SAEXS) exam assesses the candidate on the skills required to understand how the ASA functions while focusing on how to deploy and manage the Cisco ASA. This exam is required for partners to attain ASA Express Security Specialization. Click here for more information.
